channel.title: IBM Internet Security Systems Internet Threat Information
channel.description: The latest Internet Threats, brought to you by XForce - the IBM Internet Security Systems' world-renowned security research and development team.
channel.copyright: 2007 IBM Internet Security Systems. All rights reserved worldwide.

item.title: Microsoft Windows Backup Manager Could Allow Remote Code Execution
item.description: Windows Vista performs insecure dll loading when opening files associated with Windows Backup Manager .wbcat extension.

item.title: Microsoft Windows Graphics Rendering Engine buffer overflow
item.description: A vulnerability exists in the way Windows explorer renders embedded thumbnails for certain files such as Office documents.

item.title: Microsoft IIS FTP Interpret-As-Command (IAC) Overflow
item.description: IIS 7.5 has a buffer overflow vulnerability in the processing of the Telnet IAC command in the FTP response.

item.title: Microsoft Windows Fax Cover Page Editor could allow denial of service
item.description: Windows Cover Fax Page Editor has a heap overflow vulnerability in the parsing of .cov files.

item.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer CSS Remote Code Execution
item.description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Internet Explorer handles the CSS import statements.

item.title: Insecure Library Loading in Internet Connection Signup Wizard Could Allow Remote Code Execution
item.description: Windows performs insecure dll loading when opening files associated with Internet Connection Signup Wizard such as .isp and .ins.
